title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis impressed at the 2025 IIHF World Championships, scoring four goals and six points in seven games.
Locmelis, a 2022 fourth-round pick, excelled with UMass and Providence Bruins, tallying 33 points in the 2024-25 season.
Providence head coach Ryan Mougenel praises Locmelis for his quick adaptation to pro hockey and his strong hockey sense.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye for looking 'timid' in the season-opening loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots' offense and special teams struggled, leading to a 20-13 loss, despite a halftime lead.
Drake Maye faces scrutiny over handling Josh McDaniels' offense, but sees no major changes in his responsibilities.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
The crash occurred near the Boston Public Library, involving a pedestrian and an e-bike; no charges were filed.
The e-bike operator stayed at the scene; Dang was hospitalized with life-threatening injuries before his death.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience high tides this fall due to perigean spring tides caused by the moon’s orbit.
These 'king tides' occur when the moon is closest to Earth, causing tides up to four feet higher than usual.
The Stone Living Lab will host high tide events at Long Wharf, including a walking tour along the coastline.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, saying he can handle criticism and isn't a 'softie'.
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception against the Raiders.
Stefon Diggs made his Patriots debut with six receptions for 57 yards after recovering from an ACL tear.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Audit reveals DESE failed to investigate 22 supported child abuse reports over a 41-month communication breakdown with DCF.
DESE delays in addressing special education complaints resulted in average investigation delays of 111 days, audit finds.
Audit criticizes DESE for not issuing annual LGBTQ materials to schools or ensuring requested training on Safe Schools Program.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, 31, was shot and killed at a political event at Utah Valley University.
Massachusetts politicians, including Governor Maura Healey, condemned the political violence following Kirk's death.
Authorities arrested and released a suspect, but have not publicly identified them, according to the FBI.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains out of practice due to a hamstring injury since July 28, affecting Patriots' secondary.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses miss practice with foot injuries, raising concerns for Patriots' upcoming game.
Keion White missed practice due to illness; Kayshon Boutte limited with shoulder injury, affecting Patriots lineup.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye criticized his own rushed throws during the Patriots' season-opening loss to the Raiders.
The Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting only 1 out of 3 opportunities, missing chances to score.
Maye aims to improve starting games faster and capitalizing on open throws and red zone chances in future matchups.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown has four years left on his Celtics contract after signing a $304 million supermax extension in 2023.
Brown addressed playing for the Atlanta Hawks in the future, saying "you never know" during a radio interview.
Despite trade rumors, Brown is set to take a prominent role in the retooled Celtics lineup for the 2025-26 season.
